intro: Tilia preslii, commonly known as the Presl's linden, is a deciduous tree native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are produced in clusters and bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
